etymology.description: Variant of 气; distinguished to mark a phonetically borrowed meaning “to beg”.
etymology.interpretation: A graphic variant of 气, it was chosen to represent the word ‘to beg’ based on similar sound rather than composition. The distinguishing marks are not meaningful components and are unrelated to shapes like 人, 每, 复, 伤, or 旅.

examples.chinese: 他在街上乞讨(他在街上乞討)。
为了活下去，他不得不四处乞食(為了活下去，他不得不四處乞食)。
examples.pinyin: Wèile huó xiàqù, tā bùdébù sìchù qǐshí.
examples.english: To survive, he had to beg for food everywhere.

examples.chinese: 她向路人乞求一点帮助(她向路人乞求一點幫助)。
examples.pinyin: Tā xiàng lùrén qǐqiú yīdiǎn bāngzhù.
examples.english: She begged passersby for a little help.
